page.title: 04BRICKWORKS SITE, WALL.
page.content: Shenstone Brick and Pipeworks is a builders merchants supplying to local builders and to anywhere in Great Britain. It is situated at the junction of two busy main roads being the A.5 and the A.5127 which is locally known as Wall Island. They no longer actually make the bricks here but the two original kilns which were used for firing can still be seen on the site. There are 26 people employed here, 9 women and 17 men. The company was formed in 1926 when clay was discovered on the site but in 1967 it was changed to a builders merchants which is what it is at present. There is a showroom and trade counter and anything which is used for making a house can be purchased here.
